intro: Oxylobium drummondii, commonly known as Drummond's oxylobium, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, legume-like seed pods that contain several seeds. Oxylobium drummondii is often found in open woodlands and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
